column4: what is a good development tool/language for someone to start to learn to develop apps for linux?
python is very powerful and also very good for beginners as well as experts
maybe ffmpeg
what ubuntu version?
you can install 2.5.2 from the hardy-backports repository
I told you already that you need to install it from hardy-backports
pastebin the output of: apt-cache policy pidgin
http://paste.ubuntu.com/80109/
you don't have hardy-backports enabled.  Enable them in Software Sources
it is enabled
not according to what you pasted.  Pastebin your /etc/apt/sources.list
http://paste.ubuntu.com/80114/
great, so now you can do 'sudo apt-get install pidgin' to upgrade it
thenk you for the help on updating .......  im still having problems connecting pidgin to yahoo can you help?
try #pidgin
what filesystem?
i have been there and am still having problems
well, explain what you are trying to do (what permissions are you trying to set?) and what you have tried thus far (what commands?)
i have a USB HD and am trying to set it so that i can read/write to it
can you answer my question?
i havent tried anything yet
after reading the wiki page, you should be able to be a lot more precise about the permissions you want, even if you aren't sure what command would let you set them
COMMAND > FILE
